channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people have fled the Gazan city of Rafah after Israel's military ordered evacuations ahead of a ground offensive. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Search ends for suspect in fatal 'ambush' of police officer
item.description: An Ohio police officer investigating a call of a disturbance at a home was fatally shot Saturday night in what authorities described as an "ambush."

item.title: May 11, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Israel's military has ordered the evacuation of more neighborhoods in Rafah ahead of a potential major ground operation in the southern Gaza city, where over 1 million Palestinians are estimated to be displaced.

item.title: Trump trial live updates: Star witness Michael Cohen expected to take the stand
item.description: Follow the latest developments in former President Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial in New York.

item.title: May 12, 2024 - Israel-Gaza updates
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people have fled Rafah after the Israel Defense Forces ordered evacuations ahead of a ground offensive.

item.title: Ukraine strikes Russian apartment building killing 15 people, officials say
item.description: At leats 15 people were killed, Russian officials said.

item.title: The latest on the massive solar storm
item.description: A stunning aurora, caused by a severe geomagnetic storm, is painting the sky shades of pink, purple and green as it spreads into locations it rarely reaches Friday night.

item.title: More bodies found in Indonesia after flash floods killed dozens and submerged homes
item.description: Rescuers have recovered more bodies after monsoon rains triggered flash floods on Indonesia’s Sumatra Island, bringing down torrents of cold lava and mud

item.title: May 10, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The Biden administration said Friday it is "reasonable to assess" that US weapons have been used by Israeli forces in Gaza in ways that are inconsistent with international humanitarian law — but the highly anticipated report stopped short of officially saying Israel violated the law.

item.title: US soldier arrested in Russia appeals detention
item.description: A lawyer appointed for Gordon Black, a U.S. Army soldier arrested in Russia, has appealed his detention, according to the state-owned TASS news service.
